hierarchy.entry_domain: NIST SP 800-53 Security and Privacy Controls

active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs between allowlisting and denylisting for input validation in high-security environments. Use real-world examples from OWASP Top 10 breaches to support your arguments and propose a hybrid approach.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in NIST SP 800-53 controls. Topic: Information Input Validation (SI-10), Category: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Security Control Frameworks > NIST SP 800-53 > System and Information Integrity (SI) > SI-10. Incorporate these elements: - Learning Objectives: [Insert full list from above] - Active Learning: [Insert summaries] - Scaffolding: Prior knowledge + 4 layers [Insert full details] - Best Practices: Allowlisting over denylisting, multi-layer (client/server), syntax/semantic validation, secure error handling (no info leaks), use libraries like OWASP ESAPI, handle encodings. - Sources: NIST SP 800-53 Rev5 SI-10 (https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/53/r5/upd1/final), OWASP Top 10 2021 A03 Injection (https://owasp.org/Top10/A03_2021-Injection/), OWASP ASVS v4.0.3 5.1 (https://github.com/OWASP/ASVS), OWASP Proactive Controls C3 (https://owasp.org/www-project-proactive-controls/). Generate 50 high-quality flashcards following this exact schema per card: { 'type': 'Q&A|MCQ|Cloze|Scenario', 'bloom_level': 'REMEMBER|UNDERSTAND|APPLY|ANALYZE|EVALUATE|CREATE', 'scaffolding_layer': 1|2|3|4, 'front': 'Question text...', 'back': { 'answer': 'Correct answer...', 'explanation': 'Detailed explanation with ties to objectives/layers/sources...', 'source': 'Specific reference...', 'active_learning_tie_in': 'Optional link to activity...' } } For MCQs: 4 options (A-D), mark correct with **. Use distractor protocol: 3 plausible wrongs from misconceptions. Balance: 10 cards per Bloom's level, cover all layers/objectives. Ensure university-level pedagogy: active recall, spaced repetition friendly, no hints on front. Output as JSON array of 50 objects.
